info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued April 15 at 7:10PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY HEALTH ADVISORY FOR WILDFIRE SMOKE FROM 600 PM FRIDAY UNTIL 900 AM SATURDAY... The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment has issued the following... WHAT...Air Quality Health Advisory for Wildfire Smoke. WHERE...portions of southeastern Larimer County and northeastern Boulder County. Locations include, but are not limited to, Lyons. WHEN...600 PM Friday April 15 to 900 AM Saturday April 16 IMPACTS...Smoke from the 37E wildfire will affect the advisory area through Friday evening and into Saturday morning. The greatest impacts from smoke will be in sheltered valley locations in the immediate vicinity of the fire. HEALTH INFORMATION...Public Health Recommendations: If smoke is thick or becomes thick in your neighborhood you may want to remain indoors. This is especially true for those with heart disease, respiratory illnesses, the very young, and the elderly. Consider limiting outdoor activity when moderate to heavy smoke is present. Consider relocating temporarily if smoke is present indoors and is making you ill. If visibility is less than 5 miles in smoke in your neighborhood, smoke has reached levels that are unhealthy.
